dcterms:description: The few-shot teamwork (FST) problem involves combining skilled agents trained in different tasks to adapt to an unseen but related task, focusing on reducing training experience and collaborating with unfamiliar teammates.
dcterms:title: Few-shot teamwork (FST) problem

dcterms:description: Ad hoc teamwork (AHT) refers to the problem of coordinating with previously unseen teammates, requiring agents to adapt to unknown behaviors and collaborate effectively.
dcterms:title: Ad hoc teamwork (AHT)

dcterms:description: Curriculum learning involves training agents to complete complex tasks by providing a series of progressively more challenging tasks, which can accelerate the learning process.
dcterms:title: Curriculum learning

dcterms:description: Transfer learning for multiagent reinforcement learning systems focuses on knowledge transfer between agents in a single task and transferring skills between different tasks, enhancing learning efficiency.
dcterms:title: Transfer learning for multiagent reinforcement learning systems
